title: Bristol Stool Form Scale
desc: The Bristol Stool Form Scale classifies stool in correlation intestinal transit time.

orgreference.text: Lewis SJ, Heaton KW. Stool form scale as a useful guide to intestinal transit time. Scand J Gastroenterol. 1997;32(9):920-4.

other_refer.text: Lacy BE, Patel NK. Rome Criteria and a Diagnostic Approach to Irritable Bowel Syndrome. J Clin Med. 2017;6(11).

data.evidence: Selection of the appropriate type:
data.facts:
Interpretation:

Bristol Stool Scale Type

Interpretation

1-2

Associated with constipation

3-4

Normal

5

Associated with diarrhea to some degree

6-7

Associated with diarrhea

From Lacy 2017.

options.label: Separate hard lumps, like nuts (hard to pass)
Like a sausage but with cracks on its surface
Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft
Soft blobs with clear-cut edges (passed easily)
Fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool
Watery, no solid pieces, entirely liquid
